abstract: Alibaba’s mobile-payment affiliate and a private-equity firm will buy part of Yum’s China unit for a good price, but the deal may also pay off for Yum.
snippet: Alibaba’s mobile-payment affiliate and a private-equity firm will buy part of Yum’s China unit for a good price, but the deal may also pay off for Yum.
lead_paragraph: Yum Brands has added some spice at a price. The company, which owns KFC and Pizza Hut, is selling part of its China business to Alibaba’s mobile-payments affiliate and a private-equity firm run by Fred Hu, the former chairman of Goldman Sachs China. They bring valuable technology skill and connections. It is a better deal than usual for so-called cornerstone investors, but may pay off for Yum’s coming spinoff.

headline.main: Yum Brands in China Adds Owners With Skill and Connections
headline.print_headline: New Owners Add Skill and Connections Yum’s Menu in China
